diseases.name: Bacterial Leaf Blight
diseases.description: A severe disease affecting rice, caused by the bacterium Xanthomonas oryzae. Symptoms include yellowing of leaf tips, water-soaked lesions, and eventual death of the leaves.
remedies: Practice crop rotation and field sanitation.

diseases.name: Brown Spot
diseases.description: Caused by the fungus Bipolaris oryzae, this disease presents as brown, round spots on the leaves. It can lead to reduced yields if not managed properly.
remedies: Apply fungicides at the first sign of disease.
Ensure proper drainage and avoid waterlogging.
Rotate crops to break the disease cycle.

diseases.name: Healthy
diseases.description: No disease symptoms are present. The plant is thriving and showing normal growth.

diseases.name: Leaf Blast
diseases.description: A serious fungal disease caused by Magnaporthe oryzae. It appears as diamond-shaped lesions on the leaves and can destroy the entire plant if untreated.
remedies: Apply fungicides during early infection stages.
Maintain proper field hygiene and drainage.

diseases.name: Leaf Scald
diseases.description: Characterized by water-soaked lesions and necrosis of leaf margins, caused by the pathogen Microdochium oryzae.

diseases.name: Narrow Brown Spot
diseases.description: A fungal disease that causes narrow, elongated brown lesions on leaves. It can lead to significant yield loss.
remedies: Improve water management to reduce humidity.
Rotate crops to disrupt the disease cycle.

diseases.name: Neck Blast
diseases.description: A destructive disease affecting the neck of rice plants, caused by Magnaporthe oryzae. It leads to poor grain filling and reduced yields.

diseases.name: Rice Hispa
diseases.description: An insect pest (Dicladispa armigera) that causes damage to rice leaves, leading to reduced photosynthesis.
remedies: Use insecticides if thresholds are exceeded.
Promote natural predators and biocontrol methods.

diseases.name: Sheath Blight
diseases.description: Caused by the fungus Rhizoctonia solani, it leads to lesions on the leaf sheath, affecting the plant's overall health.
remedies: Practice crop rotation and field sanitation.

diseases.name: Tungro
diseases.description: A viral disease spread by leafhoppers, causing stunted growth and yellowing of rice plants.
remedies: Remove infected plants to prevent spread.
